entry.title: Supplementary lecture on plug-and-play-priors
entry.content:
Dear students,

Please find the supplementary lecture by Alex on plug-and-play priors given today here.

Sanketh

entry.title: Final project guidelines
entry.content:
The final project guidelines have been published in the assignment section.

Please follow the instructions to claim a paper from the list.
entry.summary: The final project guidelines have been published in the assignment section.

entry.title: No lecture and tutorial on 16th December

link.title: No lecture and tutorial on 16th December

entry.content:
Dear students,

The lecture and tutorial on this Thursday (16th December) are cancelled. We will make up for the missing lecture and tutorial in the coming weeks.

Enjoy!

Alex & Sanketh.

entry.title: Home assignment 1
entry.content:
Dear students,

The first homework assignment is now available in the assignments section on the website.

Enjoy! Alex & Sanketh.

entry.title: Computational imaging projects @ VISTA
entry.content:
Dear students,

We are looking for students to conduct research projects on computational imaging at the VISTA lab.

Please find below the project proposals that contain further details. Interested students can contact Tomer Weiss (tomerweiss196@gmail.com).

(1) Learning efficient dynamic MRI

(2) Task-driven efficient MIMO Radar Imaging

Sanketh.

entry.title: Tutorial recordings, today’s lecture
entry.content:
Dear students,

Please find the recordings of the tutorials available here. This page shall be from now on updated after every tutorial.

As announced earlier, Alex’s lecture today (Nov 11th) lecture is canceled. We’ll meet as usual at the tutorial at 1:30pm.

Sanketh.

entry.title: Course schedule
entry.content:
Dear Students,

Starting from Thursday, October 28th, 2021, the course weekly schedule is as follows:

  1. Thursdays, 12:30-13:30, Taub 5 and Zoom (Hybrid). Supplementary lecture, presented by Prof. Alex Bronstein.

  2. Thursdays, 13:30-14:30, Zoom only. Tutorial, presented by Sanketh Vedula.

Notes:

  • The in-class lectures are supplementary, the main lecture is covered by Alex’s videos. Weekly video-viewing schedule is defined in the syllabus. Make sure to watch the relevant video lecture each week before the class.
  • All course meetings will be held in English.
  • Everything will be recorded to provide you with maximum flexibility regarding attendance.
  • The zoom links will be published to the course mailing list.
  • Sanketh’s tutorials will be held in hybrid mode starting from November 18th, 2021.

We wish you a productive semester and hope you enjoy the course.

Good luck,

Alex and Sanketh.

entry.title: Welcome to CS236860
entry.content:
Welcome to CS236860: Digital Image Processing!

First, please read the info page carefully, it contains crucial information about the course. Next, please read the rest of the posts on this site as they contain important administrative details.

Note that the course will be held in English only.

We hope you enjoy the course and have a productive semester.

Alex & Sanketh
entry.summary: Welcome to CS236860: Digital Image Processing!
